items.text: pushes a length ball outside off into the covers
items.shortText: Chahal to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

items.text: turn off the pitch makes him reach out to the ball and with a roll of his wrists keep it down to avoid the slips
items.shortText: Chahal to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

items.text: gets inside the line to drive a flighted legbreak on leg stump to extra cover
items.shortText: Chahal to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

items.text: drives to the left of the bowler and Chahal dives to keep it to nothing
items.shortText: Chahal to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

items.text: the ball drifts into leg stump, allowing Mehidy to nurdle it to long-on
items.shortText: Chahal to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 1 run

items.text: sneaks in the googly and Mashrafe reads it well and protects his stumps
items.postText: Jainendra Tarun: "@Ramble: What's the use of umpire if every decision has to be reviewed. We have always seen reviews being misused by all teams, they all play guessing games. Sometimes they use review even when they have clearly nicked to wicketkeeper. Can you image Kohli not taking his reserved quota of review even when he is dead plumb? ICC has provided a way to minimize howlers by judiciously using reviews, its unfortunate that there is no judicious use."
items.shortText: Chahal to Mashrafe Mortaza, no run

items.preText: NARAYAN RAMANAT: "For the DRS, I have a solution. Post lost reviews for batting team, it can be given option of taking DRS but if the DRS is in favor of umpire, the batsman is out and team loses 10 runs. But if batsman is right, then a howler is avoided. Same way when fielding team loses review, it can be given option of taking DRS but if DRS is right, the opposition gets extra 10 runs else the team gets a wicket. Make the game better."
items.text: gets it above the eyeline, tempting the batsman, but Mehidy keeps his head and defends outside off
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

items.text: uses the depth of his crease and the quickness of his hands to blunt a flatter, but full-length, legbreak
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

items.text: picks the short ball ever so early, rocks back and pulls powerfully to deep square leg. Mehidy looks a proper allrounder
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 1 run

items.text: the googly rushes past the forward defensive from Mashrafe
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mashrafe Mortaza, no run

items.text: steps away from the legbreak on off stump and chops it towards cover
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mashrafe Mortaza, no run

items.text: googly to finish the over and Mashrafe doesn't pick it again. Leading edge to cover
items.postText: Amogh K: "@Tim - You might want to blame the English. Indian team management has learnt its lessons, courtesy the Ind-Eng tour and the team would thus be Horses for Courses when we travel down under. Only time will tell though"
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mashrafe Mortaza, no run

items.text: shapes for a massive sweep shot and, in the time he takes the decide whether he wants to play the shot, he's nearly bowled! Just about jams the angled blade down to keep his sticks standing
items.shortText: Chahal to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

items.text: goes for the slog sweep this time and he's comfortably beaten - Chahal danging the ball wide as he often does to attacking right-handers, forcing them to hit against the turn
items.shortText: Chahal to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

items.text: flighted delivery on middle, clips it to midwicket
items.shortText: Chahal to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

items.text: the bowler dares him to go big again - loads of flight and some room outside off - and this time Mehidy goes full-blooded and gets six over midwicket. Massive strike
items.shortText: Chahal to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, SIX runs

items.text: quicker delivery angled into the pads, Mehidy works it to midwicket
items.shortText: Chahal to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

items.text: nudges it off his pads through square leg
items.postText: Robin: "160 dot balls so far and counting. Do we have any record on the dot balls bowled by a team?"
items.shortText: Chahal to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 1 run

items.text: presses forward to a slider and gets an outside edge to third man
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 2 runs

items.text: flicks a length ball with the turn and finds midwicket
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

items.text: gets down to sweep but it's on a length and bounces extra to strike the helmet grille
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

items.text: pushes a fuller one down to long-off
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 1 run

items.text: swings hard at a wide one slid across and gets an outside edge that drops short of Chahal at short third man
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mashrafe Mortaza, 1 run

items.text: shuffles across to whip a length ball away but wears it on the pad as it bounces extra
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

items.text: shovels a length ball to cover where Rohit dives and stops
items.shortText: Kumar to Mashrafe Mortaza, no run
